action.action-desc: Mr. Vasquez (for himself, Mr. Zinke, and Ms. Leger Fernandez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food Security Act of 1985 to improve wildlife habitat connectivity and wildlife migration corridors, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Habitat Connectivity on Working Lands Act of 2025.

subsection.text: Section 1240A of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–1) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term habitat connectivity means the degree to which landscape or habitat elements facilitate native species movement among seasonal habitats.
The term big game species means native species of large mammals including, wild deer, elk, pronghorn, wild sheep, and moose.

subsection.header: Regional Conservation Partnership Program critical conservation areas
subsection.text: Section 1271F(a)(2)(C) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871f(a)(2)(C)) is amended by inserting , including restoration and enhancement of wildlife habitat connectivity and wildlife migration corridors, with a focus on big game species before ; and.

subsection.header: Enrollment in the environmental quality incentives program and the conservation stewardship program of grassland enrolled in the conservation reserve program

paragraph.text: Section 1240B(d) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–2(d)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (6), by striking A producer and inserting Except as provided in paragraph (8), a producer; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Cost-share payments for grassland enrolled in the conservation reserve program

subparagraph.text: The Secretary may provide payments under the program for costs associated with planning, design, materials, equipment, installation, labor, management, maintenance, or training with respect to eligible land that is—

clause.text: enrolled in the conservation reserve program under section 1231(d)(2)(A); and
of ecological significance, as described in section 1231(d)(2)(B)(iii).

subparagraph.text: A producer shall not be eligible for payments under subparagraph (A) for practices if the producer receives payments or other benefits for the same practice on the same land under another Federal program (other than the conservation reserve program under subchapter B of chapter 1).

paragraph.text: Section 1240J(b) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–22(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting and except as provided in paragraph (3), after paragraph (2),; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Cost-share payments for grassland enrolled in the conservation reserve program

subparagraph.text: The Secretary may provide payments under the program for costs associated with planning, design, materials, equipment, installation, labor, management, maintenance, or training with respect to eligible land that is—

clause.text: enrolled in the conservation reserve program under section 1231(d)(2)(A); and
of ecological significance, as described in section 1231(d)(2)(B)(iii).

subparagraph.text: A producer shall not be eligible for payments under subparagraph (A) for conservation activities if the producer receives payments or other benefits for the same conservation activities on the same land under another Federal program (other than the conservation reserve program under subchapter B of chapter 1).

subparagraph.header: Emergency grazing and haying access preserved
subparagraph.text: No priority resource concern, practice, or incentive pertaining to restoration and enhancement of wildlife habitat connectivity and wildlife migration corridors on the acres described above will prevent or alter emergency grazing and haying access for grassland acres enrolled in the conservation reserve program.

paragraph.header: Payment limitation for rental payments under the conservation reserve program
paragraph.text: Section 1234(g)(1) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3834(g)(1)) is amended by striking $50,000 and inserting $125,000.

subsection.header: Increased payments under the environmental quality incentives program
subsection.text: Section 1240B(d) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–2(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3)(F), by inserting and wildlife habitat connectivity before ; or; and

subparagraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking or at the end;
in clause (iv), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: addresses the conservation and restoration of wildlife habitat, including wildlife habitat connectivity and wildlife migration corridors.

subsection.text: Section 1242 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3842) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: to the maximum extent practicable, fully incorporate nonstructural methods to control livestock distribution, such as virtual fencing, into the conservation practice standards; and
provide for the appropriate range of conservation practices and resource mitigation measures available to landowners using nonstructural methods described in subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall ensure that adequate technical assistance is available for the implementation of—

subparagraph.text: nonstructural methods described in paragraph (1)(A); and
other practices that support habitat connectivity (as that term is defined in section 1240A) through Federal conservation programs.

subsection.text: Section 1244 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3844) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Encouragement of habitat connectivity and big game corridors
subsection.text: In carrying out any conservation program administered by the Secretary, the Secretary may, as appropriate, encourage—

paragraph.text: the conservation of landscape corridors and hydrologic connectivity, where native big game species (as that term is defined in section 1240A) and ecological processes can transition from one habitat to another, in order to conserve native biodiversity and ensure resiliency against impacts from a range of stressors; and
the use of conservation practices that support the development, restoration, and maintenance of landscape corridors and hydrologic connectivity.

section.text: Section 1672(d) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5925(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Research and extension grants may be made under this section for the purposes of—

subparagraph.text: understanding and addressing the barriers to the adoption of virtual fencing technology; and
studying the effects of virtual fencing technology on natural and cultural resources, such as—

clause.text: crucial winter range and stopover habitats for native big game species (as that term is defined in section 1240A of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa–1)).
